qas.question: Where was the first radio license granted?
When did the first radio stations appear?

context: The first experimental radio license was issued in Philadelphia in August 1912 to <a0_0>St. Joseph's College<a0_0/>. The first commercial broadcasting radio stations appeared in <a1_0>1922<a1_0/>: first WIP, then owned by Gimbel's department store, on March 17, followed the same year by WFIL, WOO, WCAU and WDAS. The highest-rated stations in Philadelphia include soft rock WBEB, KYW Newsradio, and urban adult contemporary WDAS-FM. Philadelphia is served by three major non-commercial public radio stations, <a2_0>WHYY-FM (NPR), WRTI (jazz, classical), and WXPN-FM<a2_0/> (adult alternative music), as well as several smaller stations.
